data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The directions have you facing forward. A person wouldn't want to go backward. The answer: no.

If you turn right you will be return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you've take 4 steps before, you will return to 6 steps. If you've taken 6 steps before, you will return to 4 steps. If you've taken 4 steps after turning around, you will return to 10 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you start from the starting point, you get to the starting point. Taking 1 step means taking 1, and taking 7 steps returns you to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

The forward instructions said to always faces forward, but there are different ways to return to your starting point. The first one is to always face forward and take one step left and take 4 steps forward for the third step and so on. The first one is to always face forward and take one step left. The second one is to always face forward and take 4 steps forward for the third step and so on. So, the answer is Yes.

To do the down, you take 1 step backward next to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
